Please update to 0.24.0

It seems the issue is fixed, I will just close it.

As described in the document, [box-shadow](https://weex.apache.org/zh/docs/styles/common-styles.html#%E9%98%B4%E5%BD%B1-box-shadow) is not supported on Android anymore.

The implement of box-shadow relies on a bug of Android, which is fixed by Google. It's time to say goodbye to box-shadow.

Please add `com.taobao.android.weex_inspection:urlconnection_interceptor` to your build.gradle.

`com.taobao.weex.urlconnection` is for debug purpose, no need to bundle it in your release app. I will just close the issue.
As this issue is not update for a while, I will just close it. Feel free to reopen it if you have further questions.

As described in the [document](https://weex.apache.org/zh/docs/components/video.html), this bug will not be fixed.

> You should consider <video> as demo purpose, and re-implement it your favourite video library.

I am not an iOS developer, but at least you should support `Vue`/`vue` and `Rax`/`rax` together.

已解决，这个native页面也是module，回调时，weex会创建一个新的module实例，所以，在被调用方法中拿原来页面中的UI是拿不到的，因为不是一个实例。
解决方案：
1，用通知告诉原页面
2，通过类单例的方式获取到原页面实例

> Question Description: [Android] Gesture event touchmove is used at the same time as animation. When performing translate animation, the position is not normal and flickers.

I don't think there is anything wrong here. You should never mix `touchmove` and `animation`, as one is listening translation and the other is making translation.
As you wish, I support Vue/vue and Rax/rax together.

I am pretty sure that `weex-0.24` supports it. If you are interesting, you can check out release branch and find out which one include waterfall.

感谢你的反馈，Weex目前是隶属于Apache Software Foundation的项目，因此在Gtihub渠道我们鼓励使用英文反馈问题。下面我将使用Google Trasnlate将你的问题翻译成英语，并以英语回答。

> Question Description: When is the waterfall version, I can't show the style of the waterfall here?

Let me explain the reason here. Weex is under ASF (Apache Software Foundation), and the Weex community has to follow the rule of ASF, which is every release/tag must be voted before published. As 0.20.1 is never voted in the community, we have to delete the tag.

You can choose `0.20.0`, which is voted and still on Github repo.

If you have other questions, you could ask in the [mailing list](https://weex.apache.org/guide/contribute/how-to-contribute.html#mailing-list)

IMO, I don't think ASF will change the rule of release procedure.

Still, not helpful.

From the log you provided, the only information I got is that you are trying to run some JS/Java code after you leave the page and I don't think it will cause any failure.

I will just close the issue and you can open another issue if you still have problems. 

*I only response the issue that are opened.*

感谢你的反馈，Weex目前是隶属于Apache Software Foundation的项目，因此在Gtihub渠道我们鼓励使用英文反馈问题。下面我将使用Google Trasnlate将你的问题翻译成英语，并以英语回答。

> Question Description: [Android] When the parent (vertical layout) property flex:1 is set, the child is not displayed.

This is a bug, of course. But it may take a really long time to fix as many UI behaviour relies on the layout code. I am glad if you can give us a PR.

I will briefly explain the layout algorithm and the reason of the bug below. There are two computing phase during Weex Layout.
* Phase 1: Calculate `hypotheticalWidth` and `hypotheticalHeight` based on`width`, `height`, border-width`, `padding`, `margin`
* Phase 2: Calculate real `width` and `height` based on `hypotheticalWidth`, `hypotheticalHeight``flex-direcon`, `align-items`, `flex` and any other flexbox related styles.

During phase 1, the width of the text or its parent is unknown, the layout algorithm has no way but assumes it is unlimited, e.g. a single line text.

During phase 2, the width and height of the text is correct, but the height of text's parent is still wrong.

**You got what you see.**
